other_tests.findings: A superﬁcial, ﬁlamentous, submucosal mass with a diameter of 0.2 mm in a sinuous shape, migrating from the right side of the buccal mucosa to the midline of the lower lip.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During a period of 4 days, the mass migrated and became less visible before reappearing more superﬁcially.

other_tests.findings: A small, female nematode was received for study; specimen was intact and approximately 25 mm in length.
Albendazole, 200 mg given twice daily, was prescribed for 3 days.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient discontinued taking albendazole after 3 doses due to nausea and noted no changes in her mouth after the removal of the parasite.
